Module dev.pdml.basicparser
Package dev.pdml.simpleparser.reader

Class PdmlReader

java.lang.Object
dev.pdml.simpleparser.reader.PdmlReader
public class PdmlReader extends Object
A character-based PDML reader.

Besides reading Core PDML, the following extensions are supported:

  • Comments
  • Character escape sequences

  • Constructor Details

    • PdmlReader

      public PdmlReader(@NotNull Reader reader, @Nullable String resourceName) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      reader - the character reader from which PDML code is read
      resourceName - the name of the resource that contains the PDML code (used in error messages)
      Throws:
      IOException

    • PdmlReader

      public PdmlReader(@NotNull Reader reader) throws IOException
      Parameters:
      reader - the character reader from which PDML code is read
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • forString

      public static PdmlReader forString(@NotNull String PDMLCode)
      A utility method to create a reader for a given string
      Note:
      This method creates a StringReader that will not be closed in the source code.
      Should therefore not be used in production code.
      Parameters:
      PDMLCode - the PDML code to be read

    • hasChar

      public boolean hasChar()
      Check if the reader is positioned at a character, or is at the end of input
      Returns:
      true if the reader is positioned at a character, false if all characters have been read already

    • currentChar

      public char currentChar()
      Get the character at which the reader is currently positioned.
      Returns:
      the current character (0 if all characters have been read already)

    • currentLineNumber

      public long currentLineNumber()
      Line number at which the reader is currently positioned. Line numbers start with 1.
      Returns:
      current line number

    • currentColumnNumber

      public long currentColumnNumber()
      Column number at which the reader is currently positioned. Column numbers start with 1.
      Returns:
      current column number

    • isAtNodeStart

      public boolean isAtNodeStart()
      Check if the reader is positioned at a node start symbol
      Returns:
      true if the reader is positioned at a node start symbol, else false

    • isAtNodeEnd

      public boolean isAtNodeEnd()
      Check if the reader is positioned at a node end symbol
      Returns:
      true if the reader is positioned at a node end symbol, else false

    • readNodeStart

      public boolean readNodeStart() throws IOException
      Read (consume) a node start symbol
      Returns:
      true if the reader consumed a node start symbol, else false
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readNodeEnd

      public boolean readNodeEnd() throws IOException
      Read (consume) a node end symbol
      Returns:
      true if the reader consumed a node end symbol, else false
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readNodeName

      @Nullable public String readNodeName() throws IOException
      Read a node name
      Returns:
      the node name if the reader is positioned at a node name, else null is returned
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readNodeText

      @Nullable public String readNodeText() throws IOException, InvalidPdmlException
      Read text contained in a node
      Returns:
      a string holding the text, or null if the reader is not positioned at text
      Throws:
      IOException
      InvalidPdmlException

    • readComment

      @Nullable public String readComment() throws IOException, InvalidPdmlException
      Read a PDML comment
      Returns:
      a string holding the comment, or null if the reader is not positioned at a comment
      Throws:
      IOException
      InvalidPdmlException

    • skipComments

      public void skipComments() throws IOException, InvalidPdmlException
      Skip a sequence of comments
      Throws:
      IOException
      InvalidPdmlException

    • skipComment

      public boolean skipComment() throws IOException, InvalidPdmlException
      Skip a single comment
      Returns:
      true if a comment has been skipped, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IOException
      InvalidPdmlException

    • skipSpaceOrTabOrNewline

      public boolean skipSpaceOrTabOrNewline() throws IOException
      Skip a single whitespace character (space, tab, or new line)
      Returns:
      true if a whitespace character has been skipped, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IOException

    • skipSpacesAndTabsAndNewlines

      public boolean skipSpacesAndTabsAndNewlines() throws IOException
      Skip a sequence of whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, and new lines)
      Returns:
      true if a whitespace sequence has been skipped, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IOException
